creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: black lacquered, high walled tray with crescent-shaped cutouts on sides near top; simple, silver wavelike pattern painted on each side; celadon glazed cup with vertical incised lines and incised square motif around lip; small bamboo cylinder
medium: Lacquer on wood, glazed ceramic, and bamboo
text: Designed by the Rinpa artist Kamisaka Sekka, this simple tobacco set would be placed as a courtesy in the covered seating area outside of the tea house. The trays are sparsely decorated with rolling waves rendered as sketches of silver maki-e against a roiro ground. The set was regularly used, as evidenced by the light underpinnings of red showing through the black overcoat and the remnants of tobacco ash in the celadon ceramic jar.
title: Tobacco tray with wave design [one of a pair]
